subject: Data
title: Bayesian vs. Frequentist: The Great Debate
description: One-minute skill: Bayesian vs. Frequentist: The Great Debate.

hook.text: Two schools of statistics have been arguing for a century. Both do math. They disagree about meaning.

buildup.text: Frequentists define probability as long-run frequency. Bayesians define it as degree of belief.

discovery.text: Frequentists ask 'how often would this happen?' Bayesians ask 'how should I update my beliefs?'

twist.text: For decades, Bayesians were marginalized in academia. Now machine learning has made Bayesian methods mainstream.

climax.text: Modern statistics increasingly blends both approaches. The debate is fading into pragmatic pluralism.

punchline.text: Both sides were half right. Together they're whole.

quiz.question: How do Bayesian and frequentist statistics differ?
options: Bayesians define probability as belief, frequentists as long-run frequency
